lines.text: [repeated line]
Know what I mean?
I want you to help me follow Henry Camarero for a few days, that's all.
Why?
Well he knows me from the original Teresa investigation...

[cutting off Jake]
No, I mean why do you suddenly need me for anything? You've been doing this all by yourself all along. I've seen you. You never even bothered to show me the picture you showed the man upstairs just now.
Evans was following Gus Niles, right? Well I think Niles wanted Evans to follow him.
You mean you think he was setting the kid up?
That's exactly what I think.
For what?
Well Evans nearly had it, he just hadn't figured out Camarero yet, that's all. He was trying to spook Niles.
Terrific! We can tell the chief that we've got a fruiter that runs when he's chased!

[responding to his partner's one-word answers]
Have you ever thought of having your own radio talk-show?
Evans was working the Teresa thing on his own time. He's killed on the same bus with Gus Niles who's looking for a grease gun that happens to be the weapon used.
And then his girlfriend winds up dead on the floor with the needle... Jake, you realize what you just did? You do it to me all the time, now you heard what the man said upstairs.
I heard him, I was up there, he's a nice man, he shoots in the low 80s, but he plays too close to the vest.
Then what are you laying all that crap on ME FOR? WHY DON'T YOU STOP IT FOR ONCE? That's YOUR personal hangup, it does NOT happen to be mine!
Can't you see it?

I see one thing, I see why you're such a good cop, and one reason only, because you're so screwed up otherwise. You're beyond human belief, you understand that? You've got nothing else, no personal life, nothing!
And what the hell are YOU worried about, your goddamned pension?
That's exactly it! Put in my twenty-five and collect my fifty-five!
All I'm asking you to do is help me tail a guy for a few days, it's routine!
IT IS NOT ROUTINE JAKE, GODDAMMIT, IF THE BOSS SAYS FORGET IT!

[to pimp he has just pushed to the floor]
What ever you are reaching for better be a sandwich coz you're gonna have to eat it!
Who's the short guy?
His lawyer.
Oh, Jake, short lawyers - they worry me. Probably got enough juice to get a Sodomy beef reduced to Following Too Close.

[after spending the day monitoring Henry Camarero]
We got a man farting in silk and playing all day.
I talked to Frank at the lab, and he got an FBI report on Gus Niles' prints from his service record.

[mildly surprised]
Uh, are you just making conversation now?
Gus Niles used to be Andrew Medford, and he was in business with Camarero for awhile. You wanna take a guess who was Camarero's alibi at the Teresa inquest?

[realizing Jake's hunch about Camarero as the bus killer has substance behind it]
How come you didn't make that in the original investigation?
Because Gus Niles was still alive then, but that's a nice question, Leo. You're using your head.

[at the bus massacre]
Sometimes I think the department ought to issue us whips and chairs.
I'm looking for Samuel Avakian.
Christ, I've never heard him called that before. What's Sammy up to now?
Where is he?
He's probably in his office, making believe he's a winner.
Know what you can do for us, Rodney? You're gonna walk down the street, you're gonna get in the back seat of that white car, or I'm gonna kick your nuts up around your neck. Know what I mean, boy?
Partner, go to the car and get on the radio.
What did I do, break another rule?
[to Davis]
What are you gonna do, son? Eyeball me to death?
you can either go to the morgue, the hospital, or you can get in that car. The decision is yours.

[When a heroin dealer trades information for a reduced sentence]
I hope you're not jerking us, Haygood. Cause if you are, by the time you come back, smack'll be legal. Know what I mean?

[about Niles' girlfriend]
She left for lunch yesterday afternoon and hasn't been heard from since. What do you think?
I'm only allowed one think a day.

[after Camerero leaves a gay bar with another man]
I think he's a fag. Things are looser now. I guess a couple years ago, that was enough to ruin you.
Well, that's what I've been saying.
Yeah, that's probably where I heard it. You think that Theresa found out about him and then didn't know which way to turn?
